results.title: Herzberg
results.creator_credit: John McAulay and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Gerhard Herzberg, winner of a Nobel Prize in 1971, is a molecular spectroscopist. This film shows Dr. Herzberg in his laboratory at the National Research Council in Ottawa where, with the aid of highly sophisticated instruments, he tracks down elusive bits of matter that are the keys to discovering what the planets, stars and the universe are made of.

results.title: The Heroes
results.brief_description: A boy with a creative impulse is exposed to the influence of war toys through his companion and through commercialism. His conscience forces him to resist. He cannot decide what is better, reation or destruction. He eventually finds destruction more amusing than appreciation or creation, he abandons his drawing pad and runs off to play war. Music composed and sung by Glen Tomasetti.

results.title: Herman holds a sales meeting
results.brief_description: A sales manager holds a sales meeting and explains his activities and operations. Flashbacks show what he really did and said. A light-hearted treatment which will counter-balance the serious side of any sales meeting.

results.title: Heritage of hops
results.creator_credit: Phillip Mark-Law, Don Anderson and Tasmanian State Film Unit
results.brief_description: The charm of the early days of hop growing in Tasmania has been preserved in many hop buildings. Modern hop growing and processing techniques are now highly sophisticated. Hops are used in beer brewing to bitter the beer.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Phillip Mark-Law, Don Anderson and Tasmanian State Film Unit

results.title: Here's sport
results.creator_credit: Ray Dicks and BBC Film Unit
results.brief_description: Pokes gentle fun at the British pre-occupation with sport, but provides at the same time a lively and comprehensive review of British sporting life, ranging from the big popular games - such as cricket and football - to indoor marbles and a race for traction engines.

results.title: Here's hockey
results.creator_credit: Leslie McFarlane, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Hockey from the inside out, showing why it is an exciting spectator sport and Canada’s most popular national game. From the Pee-Wee division to the Bantam league, from the Canadian Amateur Hockey Association to the big-league professional stars, the film climbs the ladder, showing what it takes to make a hockey player - stick-handling ability, skating speed, science, strategy, expert coaches, and expensive equipment. And from east to west, the close identification of fans with players is evident in the excited cries, not of “They’ve won,” but of “We’ve won!”
results.creator_credit_for_label: Leslie McFarlane, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Heredity
results.brief_description: The Mendelian theory of heredity and the Mendelian laws are presented by means of animated diagrams, and by showing animals which demonstrate the Mendelian theory.

results.title: Here to there
results.creator_credit: Roy A. Driver and Herschells Films
results.brief_description: Shows some aspects of Australian road transport and demonstrates the indispensable role of motor transport in the swift transit of goods, ranging from the smallest parcels, to wool and heavy machinery. Concludes with the moving of a giant 32-ton gas generator 90 miles by road.
results.description: Shows some aspects of Australian road transport and demonstrates the indispensable role of motor transport in the swift transit of goods, ranging from the smallest parcels, to wool and heavy machinery. Concludes with the moving of a giant 32-ton gas generator 90 miles by road.

results.title: Here is Canada
results.creator_credit: Tony Ianzelo, Colin Low and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Viewers outside Canada, and Canadians themselves, here have the pleasure of looking at, understanding, and discovering the many facets of this vast land, presented in choice film footage that is at once informative, visually appealing, and absorbing.
